intro: Chorizanthe commissuralis, commonly known as the desert panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Chorizanthe commissuralis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in desert ecosystems.
